items.title: 'Situation can't continue': Trump talks to Minnesota leaders as shooting anger deepens
items.description: The Trump administration indicates it could rein in its Minnesota immigration crackdown as public outrage intensifies after a federal agent killed a protester.

items.title: Government agency deliberately broke law for years, federal watchdog finds
items.description: Services Australia has known it was not fully complying with new child support laws since 2019, according to a scathing report released by the Commonwealth Ombudsman.

items.title: Breaking: Man charged with making explosives after Perth Invasion Day chaos
items.description: A 31-year-old man is charged with making explosives in suspicious circumstances after a device was allegedly thrown into a crowd of hundreds of people attending an Invasion Day rally in central Perth yesterday.

items.title: The problem gnawing at China's economy
items.description: Unlike many Western economies, Chinese households stash away more than 40 per cent of their income. But the pressure to boost local consumption is mounting for Beijing.

items.title: Two people die in light plane crash near private Gold Coast airstrip
items.description: Police say the plane crashed shortly after take-off from the private airstrip, killing two men and sparking a large fire.

items.title: Live: Emergency warning for Victorian fire, as heatwave sends temperatures soaring
items.description: A record-breaking heatwave is impacting south-east Australia, with temperatures expected to soar in parts of Victoria, South Australia and New South Wales. Follow our live coverage.

items.title: Kanye West says he 'lost touch with reality' due to brain injury
items.description: Ye, the artist formerly known as Kanye West, has taken out a full-page ad in the Wall Street Journal to apologise for past behaviour, saying he had an undiagnosed brain injury and bipolar disorder.

items.title: Live: Ley backer insists leadership speculation 'all sound and fury signifying nothing'
items.description: A backer of Sussan Ley has taken aim at the fevered speculation about a looming Liberal leadership challenge, dismissing it as "sound and fury signifying nothing". Follow live.

items.title: Live: Aus Open to enact 'extreme heat' rules as Sabalenka kicks off quarters
items.description: Near record temperatures are forecast for day 10 of the Australian Open, featuring the start of the singles quarterfinals, with Alex de Minaur and top seed Carlos Alcaraz the main event. Follow live.

items.title: 'Astonishing' purge leaves Xi Jinping almost alone at the top of the world's biggest army
items.description: Another two senior generals are under investigation for alleged corruption in China and that has big consequences for President Xi Jinping.

items.title: Live: ASX strongly higher as gold continues to soar
items.description: The ASX opens higher as gold and silver surge in price. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: Texas police urge 'wanted' Australian to hand himself in as sightings reported
items.description: Texan authorities say an extradition order may be required to resolve the "legal limbo" involving Australian man Izaak Michell.

items.title: 'Sydney don't know what's next': TikTok account banned over Bondi attack posts
items.description: The social media giant deleted the account and a host of other profiles promoting Islamic State and other violent ideology only after questioning by the ABC last week.

items.title: Divers come within metres of great white as local sightings grow
items.description: The sighting comes amid a spate of white shark reports in SA's south east, and after a tragic month of incidents in NSW.

items.title: How the Perth Scorchers have torched the competition
items.description: Six titles in 15 seasons is an extraordinary record, but what is the secret of the Perth Scorchers' incredible success?

items.title: Quiz: How well do you know your way around the world?
items.description: Which food is thrown in the re-enactment of a medieval food fight? And which airport is the world's busiest?

items.title: Life-changing DNA test helps woman uncover Jewish family history
items.description: Adriana Turk grew up believing there were no survivors on her Jewish father's side after World War II, but a DNA test showed that was not the case.

items.title: Rescue dog takes to the bush on mission to track koalas
items.description: This scruffy pup has gone from the pound to being part of a scat detection dog team, helping save endangered koalas.

items.title: Houseboat owners say they are forced out to protect million-dollar views
items.description: A David and Goliath battle is playing out on the multi-million-dollar shores of the Noosa River, where dozens of houseboat residents say they are being forced out and potentially into financial ruin.

items.title: Man charged following alleged sexual assault at Yeppen Lagoon walking track
items.description: A 27-year-old man has been remanded in custody and is due to appear in court today.

items.title: Inside the desperate bid to rescue species ravaged by myrtle rust
items.description: Scientists and nursery workers race to save a newly identified tree species in Queensland branded "living dead", after a fungal disease stopped it from growing or reproducing in the wild.

items.title: Family left devastated after second relative dies in custody
items.description: The family of a woman who recently died inside an NT police watch house is calling for answers, asking why she wasn't checked by medical staff for nearly two days, and demanding immediate action to improve conditions.

items.title: Bradman still setting records as baggy green fetches top price
items.description: A baggy green cap worn by Don Bradman in the 1947-48 series against India has been sold for $460,000 at auction.

items.title: Canberra man charged over alleged Ulladulla hit and run
items.description: Police allege the 27-year-old tested positive for cocaine and ecstasy, and returned an alcohol breath test above the legal limit.

items.title: A look at Aussie kids' unique classrooms as they prepare to head back to school
items.description: Families across the country, from the coast to the outback, are gearing up to return to school after a long, hot summer.
